alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 09 at 4:35PM AKDT until July 12 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, AND 224... .DISCUSSION...Red Flag Warnings for abundant lightning and extremely dry fuels are in effect for zones 220, 221, 222, 223 and 224 through midnight Monday night. A thermal low pressure trough stretching from McGrath to Fairbanks to Eagle will persist into Mon. This, along with a warm and unstable airmass will cause thunderstorms through Mon. Min RH will remain 26-40% through Mon. Smokey conditions will continue through Mon. A series of low pressure troughs aloft will move west across Eastern Interior over the next several days. These will cause isolated thunderstorms across the Eastern Interior, with scattered thunderstorms in the afternoon/evening over the area south of Fort Yukon through Mon night. Expect 3000 to 5000 lightning strikes each day. These troughs will also cause significant rain showers over the areas southeast of Eagle to Kantishna through Mon night. A cold front moving east across the Eastern Interior on Tue will bring cooler temperatures. By Tue thunderstorms will be confined to isolated east of Fairbanks. Cool conditions are expected from Wed through the end of the week. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT MONDAY NIGHT FOR LIGHTNING FOR DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... * AFFECTED AREA...Deltana and Tanana Flats. * TIMING...Until Midnight AKDT Monday night. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...West 5 to 10 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 33 percent. * TEMPERATURES...68 to 78. * IMPACTS...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
